Constructor Summary
Client()
          Constructs a new Client
Client(javax.swing.JTextArea textArea)
          Constructs a new Client, it gets as parameter a JTextArea in order to print the output there rather than on the console
 
Method Summary
 boolean connect(java.lang.String serverIP, int serverPort, java.lang.String nickname)
          The client connects to the server, the connection parameters such as the IP address and the port are passed to the method each time the client has to connect, the nickname is also required, because the fist message that is passed to the server is actually the nickname
 void disconnect()
          The method disconnects from the server and it closes the I/O streams and the socket, if they are open, then the thread ClientConnection is stopped too, if it were running
static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

Method Detail

connect

public boolean connect(java.lang.String serverIP,
                       int serverPort,
                       java.lang.String nickname)
The client connects to the server, the connection parameters such as the IP address and the port are passed to the method each time the client has to connect, the nickname is also required, because the fist message that is passed to the server is actually the nickname

Parameters:
serverIP -
serverPort -
nickname -
Returns:
true if the connection is set correctly

sendMessage

public boolean sendMessage(java.lang.String message)
The method sends the passed message to the server connected

Parameters:
message -
Returns:
true if the message has been sent successfully

disconnect

public void disconnect()
The method disconnects from the server and it closes the I/O streams and the socket, if they are open, then the thread ClientConnection is stopped too, if it were running

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
